com.intel.util.provider

Class ContentChangeNotificationQueue

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intel.util.provider.ContentChangeNotificationQueue

  • @NotThreadSafe
public final class ContentChangeNotificationQueue
extends java.lang.Object
    Tracks what changed during a ContentProvider operation.

    A queue initially starts out not being in batch mode.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ContentChangeNotificationQueue

        public ContentChangeNotificationQueue(@NonNull
                                      android.content.Context context,
                                      boolean isExported,
                                      @Nullable
                                      java.lang.String readPermission)
        Parameters:
        context - Application context.
        isExported - True if the provider is exported. False if the provider is not exported.
        readPermission - Optional read permission of the ContentProvider.

    • Method Detail

      • isBatch

        public boolean isBatch()
        Returns:
        True if this is currently tracking a batch operation.

      • onContentChanged

        public void onContentChanged(@NonNull
                             android.net.Uri uri)
        Parameters:
        uri - Uri whose content changed.

      • startBatch

        public void startBatch()
        Begin a batch transaction.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If a batch has already been started.
        See Also:
        endBatch(boolean)

      • endBatch

        public void endBatch(boolean shouldNotify)
        End a batch transaction.
        Parameters:
        shouldNotify - if true, a change notification should be sent for all queued Uris.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If there is no current batch.
        See Also:
        startBatch()
